verbose_text: In splenocytes, LPS can bind to Toll like receptor-4 (TLR-4), and in turn activate the transcriptional factor NF-kappaB (nuclear factor kappa-light-chain-enhancer of activated B cells) via phosphorylation, leading to translocation of NF-kappaB into the nucleus where it may regulate the production of many inflammatory cytokines, including TNF-alpha and IL-6 [XREF_BIBR].
evidence: LPS can bind to Toll-like receptor-4
